text:
Hi,
We can listen to the submitted, complete and error events from the client SDK but for instance the 'complete' event is just 'waited for 5 seconds and assumed it was completed'. So a few questions come up:

1) Is there work being done on making these events more real?
2) Are there more events we can listen to?
3) Can we already fire events from the chaincode?
4) Can we listen to events from the chaincode?

Thanks!
<@U15LJGQPN>: that's all under active development.  The fabric side was merged this week and the SDK side should follow shortly
That's great news. Could you elaborate a little bit on which parts are (more or less) ready?
That was merged this past week.  I know Patrick is also working on the SDK side
IIUC this would be primarily WRT system type events, like blocks and transactions
Chaincode events might be further out, not sure
I'd defer to <@U0ULK2JPP> and <@U0KQ9QKH6> for details
I'm guessing you are probably not using chaintool, but <@U0KRRM29Z> is adding support to the chaintool CCI schema to describe custom events for chaincode

Alright, thanks a lot. We're indeed not using chaintool, just looking for a way to handle events in a nice way from a NodeJS web application. The eventing system will bring about a massive improvement in terms of user experience (if we can use web sockets for instance)
